background: A market owner is starting a jam business and needs to decide on the allocation of jam into small packets and jugs to maximize the units sold.
constraints: Number of sets of small packets is non-negative
Total volume of jam in sets of small packets and jugs cannot exceed TotalJam ml
At least JugPacketRatio times as many jugs as sets of small packets must be used
At least MinSmallPackets sets of small packets should be filled
objective: Maximize the total number of units (sets of small packets and jugs) the market owner can sell
description: A market owner wants to start a jam business. He can either sell one unit of jam to customers in a set of small packets or jugs. A set of small packets can hold \param{VolumeSmallPackets} ml of jam while a jug can hold \param{VolumeJug} ml of jam. Since a set of small packets are more expensive to make, at least \param{JugPacketRatio} times as many jugs must be used than sets of small packets. On the other hand, at least \param{MinSmallPackets} sets of small packets should be filled. If the market owner has \param{TotalJam} ml of jam, how many sets of small packets or jugs should be selected to maximize the total number of units that he can sell to his customers?

parameters.definition: Volume for a set of small packets
Ratio of the number of jugs to sets of small packets
Minimum number of sets of small packets
